examples: As a defensive measure he built a series of coastal forts and watchtowers.
Troops took up a defensive position around the town.

meanings.def: behaving in a way that shows that you feel that people are criticizing you
examples: Don't ask him about his plans—he just gets defensive.
He is extremely defensive about his work.
Her manner was oddly defensive, as he hadn't intended any criticism at all.
Whenever anyone mentions women's rights, he gets rather defensive.

meanings.def: connected with trying to prevent the other team or player from scoring points or goals
acting in a way that shows that you expect to be attacked or criticized; having to defend yourself
examples: Their questions about the money put her on the defensive.
Warnings of an enemy attack forced the troops onto the defensive.
